bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I have a local command 'promote' that I just discovered bash wasn't completing fully because there's now a 'promoterwise' also matching. Curious as to how that showed up out of the blue I traced that down to a 'wise2' package also installed which is summarized as "Tools for comparison of bio-polymers". Um, ok. I went to remove it and ...
$ sudo dnf remove wise2 Dependencies resolved. ===================================================================================================================================== Package Arch Version Repository Size ===================================================================================================================================== Removing: adwaita-qt5 x86_64 0.97-1.fc25 @@commandline 695 k qcad x86_64 3.16.4.0-1.fc25 @local-updates 127 M qgnomeplatform x86_64 0.2-13.20161205git.fc25 @@commandline 162 k wise2 x86_64 2.4.1-1.fc25 @@commandline 10 M
Transaction Summary ===================================================================================================================================== Remove 4 Packages
Installed size: 138 M Is this ok [y/N]: n
So I was rather surprised to see qcad there. Maybe it's legit, but it sounds fishy, so here I am. Also, I use KDE Plasma so qgnomeplatform may be another unexpected dep.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): qcad-3.16.4.0-1.fc25.x86_64 wise2-2.4.1-1.fc25.x86_64 qgnomeplatform-0.2-13.20161205git.fc25.x86_64 adwaita-qt5-0.97-1.fc25.x86_64
qgnomeplatform and wise2 are both required by qcad, so yes it's correct.
qcad-3.16.5.0-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-a700d71cb8
qcad-3.16.5.0-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-3ce0440776
